projectList.title: Alarm as a Service for Brilliant Cloud Platform
projectList.content:
Developed "Alarm as a Service (AaaS)" for Brilliant Cloud Platform. Brilliant Cloud users now have the options of creating alarms and topics for their instances. A topic can be used to subscribe to a variety of alarm states. Subscribers will receive notifications when the alarm state changes. All of this can now be managed from the user's dashboard. Flask, Celery & RabbitMQ were used to develop this service.

Brilliant Portal Link: https://bcp.brilliant.com.bd/

projectList.title: Two Factor Authentication for Brilliant Cloud Platform
projectList.content:
Developed "Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)" for Brilliant Cloud Platform users. It has reduced the risk of a security breach and protected sensitive data. Users can now secure their accounts using authenticator apps, Email verification or SMS verification. The service was developed using Flask.

Brilliant Portal Link: https://bcp.brilliant.com.bd/

projectList.title: Load Balancer as a Service for Brilliant Cloud Platform
projectList.content:
This is a "Load Balancer as a Service (LBaaS)" designed for Brilliant Cloud Platform. Using it, users can automatically create, modify and monitor load balancers for their virtual machines. As a result, a user's system will be highly available, scalable and have zero downtime. Flask, Celery, and Socket.IO were used to develop it.

Brilliant Portal Link: https://bcp.brilliant.com.bd/

projectList.title: InfluxDB-Flask
projectList.content:
Flask extension that adds support for InfluxDB 2.0. This extension exposes InfluxDB APIs for use with Flask in Python. In addition to instant configuration, delayed configuration is also supported. Enhances the interaction with InfluxDB 2.0 and later.

Github Link: https://github.com/simon7426/InfluxDB-Flask

projectList.title: Multi-label Emotion Classification of Tweets Using Machine Learning
projectList.content:
Multi label emotion classification is the process of classify a text into various emotions that it represents. In this work, we performed multi label emotion classification of tweets using various advance multi label classification methods. 8 emotion classes and 13 different multi label classification methods were used in this work.

Springer Link: https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-16-6636-0_53

projectList.title: Simple Storage Service for Brilliant Cloud Platform
projectList.content:
An object storage service designed for Brilliant Cloud Platform. It acts and works like aws s3. It has it's own s3 compatible APIs. Customers of all sizes and industries can store and protect any amount of data for virtually any use case, such as data lakes, cloud-native applications, and mobile apps. The customer has the option to share the stored objects over the internet.

Brilliant Portal Link: https://bcp.brilliant.com.bd/

projectList.title: E-commerce Marketplace with Hybrid Recommendation System
projectList.content:
Based on collaborative and content-based filtering, a hybrid recommendation system was developed. Afterwards, it was deployed as part of an E-commerce website where users could create accounts, browse products, and buy and sell items. Recommendation system and e-commerce website were developed using Python's Django framework.

Github: https://github.com/simon7426/ecom-project
